meanings.definition: A publication that combines elements of a magazine and a catalogue.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy reading the colorful magalogue with fashion and home decor ideas.
meanings.sent2: The new magalogue features a variety of products for sale.
meanings.sent3: My friend mistook the magalogue for a regular magazine and tried to subscribe to it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a magalogue of memories, each page filled with moments of joy and sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The magalogue was like a treasure trove of inspiration, waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: To create or produce a magalogue.
meanings.sent1: She magalogues for a living, designing layouts for different companies.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team will magalogue the new product line next month.
meanings.sent3: I tried to magalogue my own magazine, but it ended up looking like a messy catalogue.
meanings.sent4: His creativity magalogued the pages, turning them into works of art.
meanings.sent5: The designer magalogued the images and text seamlessly, creating a visually appealing publication.

meanings.definition: The act of browsing or shopping from a magalogue.
meanings.sent1: Her favorite pastime is magalogue, flipping through pages and making wishlists.
meanings.sent2: Customers can now enjoy magalogue online, making shopping more convenient.
meanings.sent3: I caught her magaloguing during work hours, dreaming of new purchases.
meanings.sent4: In her hands, the magalogue became a gateway to a world of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The joy of magalogue is in discovering new products and trends from the comfort of home.
